name: qsiprep
author: University of Pennsylvania Lifespan Informatics and Neuroimaging Center (https://github.com/PennLINC)

groups.description: Specific options for SyN distortion correction
groups.name: SyN Distortion Correction Arguments

inputs.description: Subject folder for BIDS (folders name should be sub-XXXXX).
inputs.name: subject_dir

inputs.description: The name of the output for the outcomes of preprocessing and visual reports
inputs.name: output_dir_name

inputs.description: Select a specific acquisition type to be processed
inputs.name: acquisition type

inputs.description: Create interactive report json files on already preprocessed data.
inputs.name: interactive reports only

inputs.description: Run only reconstruction, assumes preprocessing has already completed.
inputs.name: qsiprep recon only

inputs.description: json file specifying a reconstruction pipeline to be run after preprocessing
inputs.name: qsiprep recon spec

inputs.description: Use this directory as inputs to qsirecon. This option skips qsiprep.
inputs.name: qsiprep recon input

inputs.description: Nipype plugin configuration file
inputs.name: qsiprep use plugin

inputs.description: Run anatomical workflows only
inputs.name: qsiprep anatomical workflows only

inputs.description: Ignore anatomical (T1w/T2w) data and process DWIs only
inputs.name: qsiprep dwi only

inputs.description: Configure pipelines to process infant brains
inputs.name: qsiprep infant

inputs.description: Generate boilerplate only
inputs.name: qsiprep boilerplate
verbose
inputs.description: Increases log verbosity for each occurence (-vvv).
Ignore selected aspects of the input dataset to disable corresponding parts of the workflow (a space delimited list)
inputs.name: qsiprep ignore

inputs.description: Treat dataset as longitudinal - may increase runtime
inputs.name: qsiprep longitudinal

inputs.description: Any value in the .bval file less than this will be considered a b=0 image. Current default threshold = 100; this threshold can be lowered or increased. Note, setting this too high can result in inaccurate results.
inputs.name: qsiprep b0 threshold

inputs.description: Window size in voxels for ``dwidenoise``. Must be odd (default: 5). If 0, ``dwidwenoise`` will not be run (default: 5)
inputs.name: qsiprep dwi denoise window

inputs.description: Method for Gibbs-ringing removal. - none: no action - mrdegibbs: use mrdegibbs from mrtrix3
inputs.name: qsiprep dwi unringing method

inputs.description: skip re-scaling dwi scans to have matching b=0 intensities
inputs.name: qsiprep no b0 harmonization

inputs.description: [DEPRECATED] Run ``dwidenoise`` before combining dwis. Requires ``--combine-all-dwis``
inputs.name: qsiprep denoise before combining

inputs.description: Run ``dwidenoise`` after combining dwis. Requires ``--combine-all-dwis``
inputs.name: qsiprep denoise after combining

inputs.description: [DEPRECATED] Combine dwis from across multiple runs for motion correction and reconstruction.
inputs.name: qsiprep combine all dwis

inputs.description: Don't attempt to combine dwis from multiple runs. Each will be processed separately.
inputs.name: qsiprep separate all dwis

inputs.description: How to combine images across distorted groups. - concatenate: append images in the 4th dimension - average: if a whole sequence was duplicated in both PE directions, average the corrected images of the same q-space coordinate - none: Default. Keep distorted groups separate
inputs.name: qsiprep distortion group merge

inputs.description: Write a series of voxelwise bvecs, relevant if writing preprocessed dwis to template space
inputs.name: qsiprep write local bvecs

inputs.description: Volume and surface spaces to resample dwis into - T1w: subject anatomical volume - template: deprecated. Will be ignored
inputs.name: qsiprep output space

inputs.description: Volume template space
inputs.name: qsiprep template

inputs.description: The isotropic voxel size in mm the data will be resampled to after preprocessing. If set to a lower value than the original voxel size, your data will be upsampled using BSpline interpolation.
inputs.name: qsiprep output resolution

inputs.description: Degrees of freedom when registering b0 to T1w images. 6 degrees (rotation and translation) are used by default.
inputs.name: qsiprep b0 to t1w transform

inputs.description: Number of iterations for finding the midpoint image from the b0 templates from all groups. Has no effect if there is only one group. If 0, all b0 templates are directly registered to the t1w image.
inputs.name: qsiprep intramodal template iters

inputs.description: Transformation used for building the intramodal template.
inputs.name: qsiprep intramodal template transform

inputs.description: Align to the 'first' b0 volume or do an 'iterative' registration of all b0 images to their midpoint image
inputs.name: qsiprep b0 motion correction to

inputs.description: Transformation to be optimized during head motion correction
inputs.name: qsiprep head motion correction transform

inputs.description: Model used to generate target images for hmc. If 'none' the non-b0 images will be warped using the same transform as their nearest b0 image. If '3dSHORE', SHORELine will be used. If 'eddy_ingress', the dwis are assumed to have been run through fsls eddy.
inputs.name: qsiprep head motion correction model

inputs.description: Path to a json file with settings for the call to eddy. If no json is specified, a default one will be used. The current default json can be found here: https://github.com/PennBBL/qsiprep/blob/master/qsiprep/data/eddy_params.json
inputs.name: qsiprep eddy configuration

inputs.description: Number of SHORELine iterations.
inputs.name: qsiprep SHORELine iterations

inputs.description: Impute data in slices that are this many SDs from expected. If 0 (default), no slices will be imputed
inputs.name: qsiprep impute slice threshold

inputs.description: Select ANTs skull-stripping template
inputs.name: qsiprep skull strip template

inputs.description: Do not use a random seed for skull-stripping - will ensure run-to-run replicability when used with --omp-nthreads 1
inputs.name: qsiprep skull strip fixed seed

inputs.description: [DEPRECATED] ensures that spatial normalization is run, Useful if you plan to warp atlases into subject space.
inputs.name: qsiprep force spatial normalization

inputs.description: Skip running the t1w-based normalization to template space. Default is to run the normalization.
inputs.name: qsiprep skip t1 based spatial normalization
fs_license_file
inputs.description:
Path to FreeSurfer license key file.
Get it (for free) by registering at https://surfer.nmr.mgh.harvard.edu/registration.html
Run the FreeSurffer recon-all pipeline
inputs.name: qsiprep do reconall

inputs.description: Forces unwarping to use files from the fmap directory instead of using an RPEdir scan from the same session.
inputs.name: qsiprep prefer dedicated fmaps

inputs.description: Fit a B-Spline field using least-squares (experimental)
inputs.name: qsiprep fmap bspline

inputs.description: Do not remove median (within mask) from fieldmap
inputs.name: qsiprep fmap no demean

inputs.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Use fieldmap-free distortion correction. To use this option, 'template' must be passed to --output-space
inputs.name: qsiprep use syn sdc

inputs.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Use fieldmap-free distortion correction. To use this option, 'template' must be passed to --output-space
inputs.name: qsiprep force syn

inputs.description: Enable Nipype's resource monitoring to keep track of memory and CPU usage
inputs.name: qsiprep resource monitor

inputs.description: Only generate reports, don't run workflows. This will only rerun report aggregation, not reportlet generation for specific nodes.
inputs.name: qsiprep reports only

inputs.description: Write workflow graph.
inputs.name: qsiprep write graph

inputs.description: Force stopping on first crash, even if a work directory was specified.
inputs.name: qsiprep stop on first crash

inputs.description: Use low-quality tools for speed - TESTING ONLY
inputs.name: qsiprep sloppy

output-files.name: Output Directory
output-files.description: This is the directory where the overall outputs are to be stored.

custom.cbrain:author: Erik Lee <leex6144@umn.edu>, Timothy Hendrickson <hendr522@umn.edu> and Natacha Beck <nbeck@mcin.ca>
